item.title: Report X-2023051414
item.description:
Report X-2023051414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-22T12:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WEIGHT WAS INCORRECT SHIPPED AS 25 POUNDS BUT THE ACTUAL WEIGHT OF THE PACKAGE WAS 70 LBS. DURING THE PROCESS OF WEIGHING THE PACKAGE IT BROKE OPEN DISCOVERING APPROXIMATELY 139 LITHIUM ION BATTERIES FOR TWO-WAY RADIOS. SOME OF THE BATTERIES HAVE CLIPS ON THEM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS A CONTENT DESCRIPTION HANDWRITTEN STATING 184 BATTERIES. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM BILLINGS, MONTANA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 2281FA, UNITED RENTALS-D40, 5710 E 56TH AVE UNIT C, COMMERCE CITY CO 80022.

item.title: Report E-2023020450
item.description:
Report E-2023020450

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-21T21:09:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-21
  • City: BUTTE
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal UBU experienced a UN1760 Liquid Acid Descaler release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the concrete dock floor due to a bad seal/fault lid. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged pail and impacted absorbents were placed into a 35-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023020247
item.description:
Report X-2023020247

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-21T21:09:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-23
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was sitting outside QA work area in a plastic bag when I showed for work 1/23/2023 @ 330 am. I then doned my PPE and placed package inside a hazmat tote. Upon my inspection I found inadequate inner packing material which caused the can to dent, in turn causing the lid to unseal and product to spill out. DescribePack: loose lid DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in proper hazmat tote and thick hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2022120513
item.description:
Report X-2022120513

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-21T21:09:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-11-14
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: when gathering repack packages from the unload, during below freezing temperatures outside, this package was places on the repack cart inside a hazmat tote with bag. Upon my inspection I found that the bubble wrap inside the box had deflated and also the lid on the plastic bottle had come unscrewed. I then printed the sds for the product, doned the proper PPE, and inspected further. At that time I found that roughly 1 liter of the product had leaked out. DescribePack: loose screw on cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package is placed in hazmat bag and tote

  • City: Logan
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: MONTANA RAIL LINK
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 09:30 in September 13, 2022 car UTLX 208497 was identified by the local Trainmaster to have a leak from the top of the car. MRL Mechanical was notified and dispatched a HazMat Technician from Laurel, MT. The HazMat Technician arrived on scene at approximately 12:20 and inspected the car. A manway bolt was found to be less than tool tight. The Hazmat Technician verified the gasket was in working order and the manway bolt was tightened at 13:15.

item.title: Report E-2022090545
item.description:
Report E-2022090545

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-21T21:09:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-30
  • City: BILLINGS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Terminal USB contacted ERTS to report a 5 gallon spill of UN3264 "Ferric Sulfate Solution" corrosive liquid, acidic, inorganic, nos that spilled from a plastic 330 gallon tote. ERTS dispatched Hanser's Environmental to complete clean-up/tote transfer. At 2330 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 gallons of product released to a 1' x 2' area of the dock floor due to a puncture. The material remaining in the damaged tote was transferred into a new tote. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas and collected. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all waste into a 30 gallon and 95 gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2022081079
item.description:
Report X-2022081079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-21T21:09:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-29
  • City: GREAT FALLS
  • State: MT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UTLX 204218 was found in the Great Falls yard to be leaking product from the combination housing. Upon inspection, it was noted that the liquid valve was less than tool-tight on the threaded nipple on the pressure plate. The reasoning behind this is that the handle for the valve would not allow for the combination housing cover to close if tool-tightened properly. The valve was removed, the threads re-taped and the valve tool-tightened. The valve handle was removed and zip-tied inside the combination housing.
